item.description:
Hi all,

This is a second try to run a mystery and intrigue module. Since last time was cancelled due to player mis-expectations, please read carefully and ask questions before committing. :)

Here is extensive info:

1. DM or organizer's name and preferred contact info: I will DM.
2. City/Location of the most common place you will be playing: Stoneham.
3. Campaign world for the game: Not applicable, not full-fledged world
4. What you really need to know and think about: It is a DARK story. Individual character goals may not be the same as party goals.
5. System: DnD 3.5 will be used, but the game is mostly not dependent on DnD, although player knowledge with the system is preferred. Don't expect standard DnD adventure! Yes, I could do this in but I won't. :)

For this module the style is:
Roleplaying: 8
Action: 2.5
Story: 9

More detailed info:

-------------------------------------

It's a preset module for 6 players plus/minus 1. It's a module in a fantasy world, so all conventions apply. It starts with some adventurers accused of a crime that may result in some heads rolling. There is also a dark prophecy that hangs over the city... but maybe there is a way to figure out what really happened and change what will happen...

Here are some restrictions:
Players cannot select character race, background, etc. There will be 6-7 characters to play. Some things are open for personalization though, e.g. alignment.

We will use 3-3.5 edition rules. However, it will be ROLE PLAY biased, so don't expect to select an ability from the rules and tell DM that it does X instead of Y. Also don't expect a lot of combat or leveling. It's much more a brain game than brawn game though combat can still save your life.

Finally, individual character goals may not be the same as party goals. This is not going to be Paranoia, but it's also not going to be "happy elf meeting in a meadow". :)

The game starts in an isolated town, an outpost of civilization in wild country (think Roman Britain). The genre of the game is mystery. Religion will play a substantial role and will be taken from Player's Handbook ed. 3. Characters start at about level 6 and may finish at the same level.

Here are short descriptions of characters:

Class - fighter
Race - human
Alignment: any.
Size of prehistory: 7
Other: sergeant of city guard

2. Name (Olivier Baccard) - John Jacob
Class - rogue
Race - (human)
Alignment: any.
Size of prehistory: 9
Other: officer of city's Thieves guild

3. Name (Trend Styros) - Paula
Class - wizard.
Race - (human)
Alignment - fixed / unknown to others.
Size of prehistory: 7
Other: representative of city's Mage guild.

4. Name (Bob) Terder
Class - (fighter)
Race - (human)
Alignment - any non-evil.
Size of prehistory: 2
Other: adventurer, new to the city. Brother of character No 5, so the race should be the same

5. Name (Jack) Terder
Class - (barbarian)
Race - (human)
Alignment - any non-evil.
Size of prehistory: 2
Other: adventurer, new to the city. Brother of character No 4, so the race should be the same.

6. Name (Gurd Dorrick)
Class - paladin
Race - (half-orc)
Alignment - Lawful good (paladin prerequisite)
Size of prehistory: 2
Other: adventurer, new to the city.
